q: Perhaps not surprisingly, Donald Rumsfeld by no means suggests that the war itself was a mistake. He holds to the theory that had the coalition forces not toppled Saddam Hussein , the whole region would be far more perilous than it is today . As for his own style of presentation, he was guilty of quips, he admits now, that would have been better unsaid, including`` stuff happens'' in reference to mass looting in Baghdad

Still, she said Michael Vick 's dogfighting operation probably helped pit bulls' bad rep because it showed that`` people can reintroduce these dogs back into a society that's not going to abuse them.'' The owner is responsible for what an animal does. It's totally your behavior, whether you have a good dog that minds well and is not a problem to society or you turn it into a vicious animal that will bite the mailman, the girl next door or grandma walking down the street, Michael Hansen said. the current spring in Donald Rumsfeld 's step is the resulting abandonment by Barack Obama of much of his strident opposition to President Bush 's anti-terrorism policies. Turning to Dick Cheney at CPAC, Donald Rumsfeld taunted the Left by saying: I look at the current administration's many reversals of their announced policies on national security issues- Guantanamo Bay, military commissions, indefinite detention, CIA drone strikes.`` It makes me wonder if Dick Cheney has had more influence on Barack Obama than the people that got him elected. The vociferous anger of the Rand Paul supporters at CPAC indicated that Republicans remain divided over the President Bush legacy. The Paulites, however, are very much in the minority.
